message.content:
<<<api>>>: TypedArray.getString
<<<code>>>: public class MyTextView extends TextView{
    public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyle)
    {
        super(context, attrs, defStyle);
        init(attrs);
    }
    public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs)
    {
        super(context, attrs);
        init(attrs);
    }
    public MyTextView(Context context)
    {
        super(context);
        init(null);
    }
    public void init(AttributeSet attrs)
    {
        if(attrs != null){
            TypedArray a = getContext().obtainStyledAttributes(attrs, R.styleable.MyTextView);
            String fontName = a.getString(R.styleable.MyTextView_fontname);
            if(fontName != null){
                Typeface myTypeface = Typeface.createFromAsset(getContext().getAssets(), "fonts/" + fontName);
                setTypeface(myTypeface);
            }
            a.recycle();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the init() method, we first check if the AttributeSet is not null. If it's not null, we obtain the custom attributes from the AttributeSet using the obtainStyledAttributes() method. We then get the font name from the TypedArray using the getString() method and check if it's not null. If it's not null, we create a new Typeface from the font file in the assets directory and set it to the TextView using the setTypeface() method. Finally, we recycle the TypedArray to free up its resources.
